description: silver glazed horizontal rectangular ceramic with series of 7 ears in rectangular niches; ears increasing in size from L to R; square perforations across top, increasing in size from L to R; steel mount with flat rectangular base and two vertical rods that fit into holes at bottom of ceramic sculpture
signed: stamped at lower R front corner: 光 {Hikaru}
text: Yamada Hikaru was a founding member of the influential artist group Sōdeisha, literally the Crawling through Mud Association, that was instrumental for the birth of an avant-garde in Japanese ceramics. Originally trained in making utilitarian vessels, its members experimented with new forms and began creating unusual and individual sculptures.
title: Fading Voice
